p: Aimed at clarifying possible molecular mechanisms involved in the relaxation induced by EO S in tracheal rings, we explored the effects of EO S on the roles of the K Ca and Ca 2+ channels, and on NO release. Actually, the crucial roles of K Ca and l-type Ca 2+ channels, as well as NO release in airway smooth muscle contraction are well known [ 17, 23, 25, 26, 27, 28, 29, 33, 34, 35], and they are important therapeutic targets.
